sessions.name: Matlab
sessions.description: The technive season has came back, in its most newfangled version, Prajwalan'19 presents MATLAB Workshop under the patronage of Make In India and Digital India. MATLAB has wide scope and is essential for all the branches. MATLAB is used to perform virtual simulation, graphical output, complex mathematical calculations, image processing etc. But before all the advance level, how to get started? Here is the opportunity for you to learn the basics of the software, which will help you to get acquainted with the MATLAB software. Grab the opportunity!

speakers.name: Andromaster
speakers.desc: Are you an android expert? Participate in AndroMaster and win prizes!
speakers.about3: 2.Those who will qualify will be selected for next round and others are disqualified.

speakers.about6: 2. Those who complete the task within time limit, will be allowed for the next round.
speakers.about9: 2.Participants will be provided with stock ADT and a certain time limit. High speed internet will be provided.
speakers.about10: 3.Participants are free to do anything with their ADT like install remove and delete apps, change gui etc.
speakers.about11: 4. The best android user will be picked and be given title Andromaster

speakers.name: Box Cricket
speakers.desc: Love playing gully? Love the one tip one hand out? Play Box Cricket but for prizes this time!

speakers.name: Chanakya
speakers.desc: Have a great G.K.? Want to be the new age Chanakya? Then this is the event for you.
speakers.about1: 1. This event is basically a technical quiz competition which will be played in form of teams whose stength will vary will respect to give round. Initially the maximum strength of the team wil be 2 members.
speakers.about2: 2. The interesting part about the event is that the maximum part will be played on the pc and visual screen.
speakers.about3: 3. This event will check one's ability that he/she has command over various fields including technical, sports, political current affairs etc. It will also test your reflexes and accuracy.
speakers.about4: 4. If anyone found performing unethical practice will be disqualified on the immediate basis.
speakers.about5: Fees: EVENT REGISTRATION FEES: Rs. 100/- (per team of 2 members)
speakers.rules1: 1. Chanakya vevnt will have three rounds and one final Buzzer round to decide the winner of this event.
speakers.rules2: Round 1: The name of this wordd is directo which will be straight forward round. This round will be plaed with team of two mwmbers. 15 MCQs type questions will be asked among various fields and the limit will be 10 mins. Top 60 teams will be qualified for the next round.
speakers.rules3: Round 2: The name of this round is double-trouble. Both these rounds will be knoch-out rounds. Teams will be combined in form of 4 members per team only for these rounds.
speakers.rules4: Sub-rounds 1: There will be a rapid fire round. 12 questions will be asked in a span of 100 seconds. Top 20 teams will go play the next sub-round.
speakers.rules5: Sub-round 2: There will be a simple quizaround where teams will be given a provision to choose topic if their interest on which questions will be asked. Top 10 teams will be qualified for next round.
speakers.rules6: Round 3: The name of this round is long visual round. Different questions will be asked on the basis of slides that will be shown to participants. This round will be played with the original set of two members. Top five teams will play final buzzer round.
speakers.rules7: Final Buzzer Round: This will be the toughest round among all the other rounds as we will find one chanakya of our Chanakya event. 10 ques will be asked will be asked in this round. Infront of each team there will be a buzzer which they have to use while answering. The team with the maximum points will become the winner of the event.

speakers.name: Ciruit Mania
speakers.desc: Passionate about electronics?Play around with electronic components,build circuits and win prizes.
speakers.about3: 2. Group A- for diploma, 1st and 2nd year engineering students.
speakers.about4: 3. Group B- for 3rd and final year engineering students.
speakers.about7: 1. There are about 4 rounds for each group separately.
speakers.about8: 2. Difficulty level is more for engineering students(group B) than diploma students(group A).
speakers.about12: 1. It consists of 30 questions for 30 marks.
speakers.about13: 2. The questions will be based on technical knowledge of electronics.
speakers.about14: 3. Both groups will have different apptitude tests.
speakers.about15: 4. The cut off marks will be decided according to the average marks scored by the participants.
speakers.about17: Round 2: Component and Circuit Identifications.(30 mins)
speakers.about18: 1. The images of different components and circuits will be given to teams they will have guessed the components and circuits correctly.
speakers.about20: 1. The circuit diagram of same electronic circuits will be given to the teams.
speakers.about21: 2. Teams should be mount and run that circuit on breadboard in minimum time will be shortlisted for next round.
speakers.about22: Round 4: Circuit Designing and Building (60 mins)
speakers.about23: 1. The shortlisted teams will get a circuit name.
speakers.about24: 2. They should ask for the circuit components according to the circuit requirement.
speakers.about25: 3. They should build the circuit on the breadboard.
speakers.about26: 4. The team which shows the corrrect circuit in the minimum time will be declared as winner.
speakers.about27: Fees: EVENT REGISTRATION FEES: Rs. 120/- (max 2 members)

speakers.name: Contraption
speakers.desc: Feel you can make the laws of physics do your bidding? Perform simple physical tasks and win prizes.
speakers.about1: CONTRAPTION is one of its kind event which puts your basic engineering skills like mechanics, electronics and physics to perform a task.
speakers.about4: 1) To drop a ball in bucket with maximum number of bounces. (once dropped, the ball must stay in the bucket)
speakers.about5: 2) Draw a circle of radius minimum 5 cm to maximum 10 cm of radius
speakers.about7: 1) To write x and erase it
speakers.about8: 2) To seperate a mixture of sand, sawdust & iron.
speakers.about9: 3) To raise the flag up-to the 30 cm height
speakers.about11: 5) Burst a ballon filled with air.
speakers.about19: Teams have to submit a report at the time of competition which will contain a detail description of each of steps of energy conversion. After going through the report and seeing the working arrangement the judges will decide correct number of steps and energy conservation in arrangement,
speakers.rules2: 1) 1 main task and 3 sub tasks are compulsory.
speakers.rules3: 2) Bonus points will be awarded for extra subtasks.
speakers.rules4: 3) Maximum 2 hand touches are allowed (including initial touch). After that 30 points will be deducted for every hand touch.
speakers.rules5: 4) 5 dominoes will be considered as 1 link.
speakers.rules9: 8) Only main types of energy conversion will be taken in consideration

speakers.name: Junk Art

speakers.name: LAN Battle
speakers.desc: Brace yourself to rule the world of PC gaming!

speakers.name: Mastermind
speakers.desc: Think you can outwit them all? Find the treasure fast and become the MasterMind.
speakers.about1: The concept is like a treasure hunt. Finding objects hidden by others. Originally an outdoor activity for children to find objects hidden by others. Innovation- this time it is indoor and that of specially in PC. PC based (at most two players game). Finding some hidden treasure among fake treasure with given clues. Round 1:DECRYPT THE PASSWORD The PC will be locked with some password, the participants will be given the clues of password and they have to unlock the PC. Round 2:FIND THE HIDDEN TREASURE Some files or folders will be hidden at some particular location in the PC .Participants will be provided with the clues of the location where they are hidden and they have to search them (Treasure). Round 3:OBSERVE, THINK AND SEARCH Participants will be given some images (may be of any person or monuments or structures etc) on the PC. Firstly, they have to recognize the image and then they have to search the same image with the same dimensions on the internet. In case, if there is a TIE between any of the participants then there will be a surprise round conducted for them.1st Prize: 2000/-(cash)
speakers.about2: Fees: EVENT REGISTRATION FEES: Rs. 100/-(for a team of 2 members)
speakers.rules2: 1)At max 2 players can participate in one team.
speakers.rules3: 2)All decision of MasterMind committee will be acceptable to all players.
speakers.rules4: 3)lf any interruption occurs, in such case decision of convener will be acceptable to all members.
speakers.rules5: 4)Participants who will not follow above rules will be disqualified with his team.
speakers.rules6: 5)0ther rules will be notified on the spot.

speakers.name: Model Exhibition
speakers.desc: Got the high-tech vision? Create innovative models and win prizes.
speakers.about1: There will be four groups in the event-
speakers.about5: 4) Group D (Mechanical) Participants: Each participating team comprises of minimum of 3 and maximum of 8 team members. Teams have to bring their models belonging to any of the above groups
speakers.about6: Judging Criteria: There will be 2 judges for each group (one external and one from the college itself). Judging criteria will be discussed with the judges.
speakers.about7: Fees: EVENT REGISTRATION FEES : Rs.100/- per member
speakers.rules2: Your model should have some innovative basis and practical approach.
speakers.rules3: Criteria: Judges decisions will be based on 5 criteria:

speakers.name: Mystery Hunt
speakers.desc: Hurry up, Mr.Sherlock! Solve the mysteries to win prizes.

speakers.name: Paper Presentation
speakers.desc: Pull up your socks and gather all your research work to win exciting prizes!
speakers.about1: Research work should be written and presented effectively by covering all the engineering aspects of the topic chosen. Paper will be judged on the context and its originality, flow of presentation, communication skill and coordination among team members.
speakers.about3: Round1: Abstracts will be invited from the participants. Shortlisting of abstracts. The selected participants will be informed via email.
speakers.about5: This round will comprise of the final presentation followed by a question answer session.
speakers.about6: Participants:- Each team can have a maximum of two members.
speakers.about11: Top 25 teams selected for final presentation: Rs. 250/-
speakers.rules2: 1. The paper must strictly follow IEEE format.
speakers.rules3: The paper should not exceed 12 pages.
speakers.rules4: The theme of the paper must be relevant to the mentioned topics
speakers.rules5: The paper should be essentially in a two column format; Font style: Times New Roman; Font size: 12; Heading font size: 14 (bold).
speakers.rules6: Only purely technical papers with valid references would be considered for short listing.
speakers.rules7: Teams will get 4+2 minutes for presentation followed by question answer session.
speakers.rules8: Any violation of the rules may result in rejection of the paper.
speakers.rules9: The organizers and the judges reserve the right to take the final call in case of any unusual circumstance cropping up.
speakers.rules10: Rules and details of the final round will be sent to the selected participants via email.

speakers.name: Robotics
speakers.desc: Explode into the world of humanoids and bots and compete to be the best.

speakers.name: Rubik's Cube
speakers.desc: Put on your game face and solve the cube as fast as possible.
speakers.about1: Ever thought of solving a cube in less than 15 seconds? Ever dared to attempt that one handed or blind-folded? We here offer that to you to learn and the perfect your skills.
speakers.about2: Very rare and unique opportunity for your child to participate in Rubik's cube workshop.
speakers.about3: Rubik's Cube is only gaming activity that directly helps your child to develop *6 intelligence * (Visual, Fine motor skills, logic, Recollection Memory, 3D Visualization & Space Management)
speakers.about4: We have created a special opportunity of Rubik's Cube Workshop for EVERYONE.
speakers.about6: 1. Introduction to various cubes and similar puzzles
speakers.about7: 2. Learn how to solve a 3*3*3 cube.
speakers.about9: 4. Tips and Tricks for getting faster at solving cubes.
speakers.about11: Workshop 1:The workshop is based on the development of cube solving skills of the pupil involving the 3*3*3Rubik's cube. In this session, the participant will be taught the beginner's method for solving the Rubik's cube. Further, there will be given brief introduction about speed cubing involving the CFOP method.
speakers.about12: Workshop 2: The participants will be taught how to solve a Mirror cube. Hence, the second workshop is totally based on the development of the Mirror cube solving skills of the pupil.
speakers.about14: The second session of event comprises of two different competitions:
speakers.about17: Rubik's cube competition/ speed cubing: Round 1: participant have to solve the given cube within 120 seconds. If they solve the cube in 120 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round.
speakers.about18: Round 3: This is the final round. Participant have to solve the given cube within 60 seconds. If they solve the cube in 60 seconds or lesser time then their average time will be calculated.
speakers.about19: The participant with the lowest average time will be qualified as the winner of the Rubik's cube / speed cubing competition. The participant with the next lowest average time will be the runner-up.
speakers.about21: Round 1: participant have to solve the given cube within 300 seconds. If they solve the cube in 300 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round
speakers.about22: Round 2: Participant have to solve the given cube within 200 seconds. If they solve the cube in 200 seconds or lesser time then they will be qualified for the next round.
speakers.about23: Round 3: Participant have to solve the given cube within 100 seconds. If they solve the cube in 100 seconds or lesser time then their average time will be calculated
speakers.about24: The participant with the lowest average time will be qualified as the winner of the Mirror cube competition The participant with the next lowest average time will be the runner-up.
speakers.rules2: No data found for this session.

speakers.name: Web-Einstein
speakers.desc: Brush up your coding skills and bring out the designer in you.
speakers.about2: Webeinstein is an event of web designing. This is an event in which participants gets an opportunity to showcase their web designing skills. This year we have focused on 360-degree approach for our event to ensure a complete success and a great participetion of participants in prajwalan 2k18.

speakers.about7: Event will be conducted in Two Rounds.

speakers.about10: 20 simple MCQs will be given to be solved in 30 minutes.
speakers.about11: Participants are required to attempt all the questions. Qualified teams will be eligible for Round 2 (FINAL ROUND)
speakers.about14: Team will be provided with 1 PC and with resources for Designing Web Page.
